abstract: Statoil, the Norwegian energy giant, said that it had sold partial interest in some of its American energy development leases to Cnooc of China, the first time that a Chinese company would take an ownership interest in energy asset in the United States.
snippet: Statoil, the Norwegian energy giant, said that it had sold partial interest in some of its American energy development leases to Cnooc of China, the first time that a Chinese company would take an ownership interest in energy asset in the United S...
lead_paragraph: Update | 3:43 p.m. Statoil, the Norwegian energy giant, said Wednesday that it had sold a partial interest in some of its American energy development leases to the China National Offshore Oil Corporation, known as Cnooc. It is the first time that a Chinese company would take an ownership interest in energy assets in the United States.

headline.main: Statoil Sells U.S. Oil Interest to Chinese Company
